body_html:
While checking why my app required READ_PHONE_STATE I found out some things I want to share:

  • crobertsbmw is absolutely right, the workaround is very helpful!
  • the fix mentioned by PaulWoitaschek was merged before release of 1.10.0 lib, which still does NOT contain the fix and asks for the permission in question. (I assume a merge readded the code snippet)
  • the actual master commit bf23e5f does again contain the fix and does not require the READ_PHONE_STATE permission

I hope the permission is fixed by next release of tensorflow-lite lib 1.11.0
body_text:
While checking why my app required READ_PHONE_STATE I found out some things I want to share:

crobertsbmw is absolutely right, the workaround is very helpful!
the fix mentioned by PaulWoitaschek was merged before release of 1.10.0 lib, which still does NOT contain the fix and asks for the permission in question. (I assume a merge readded the code snippet)
the actual master commit bf23e5f does again contain the fix and does not require the READ_PHONE_STATE permission

I hope the permission is fixed by next release of tensorflow-lite lib 1.11.0
body:
While checking why my app required READ_PHONE_STATE I found out some things I want to share:
- crobertsbmw is absolutely right, the workaround is very helpful!
- the fix mentioned by PaulWoitaschek was merged before release of 1.10.0 lib, which still does NOT contain the fix and asks for the permission in question. (I assume a merge readded the code snippet)
- the actual master commit [bf23e5f](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/bf23e5f0f6e75a35521b7765da9863dbc24d8a71) does again contain the fix and does not require the READ_PHONE_STATE permission

I hope the permission is fixed by next release of tensorflow-lite lib 1.11.0
